com.stormpath.sdk.resource

Interface CollectionResource<T extends Resource>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Resource
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccessTokenList, AccountLinkList, AccountList, ApiKeyList, ApplicationAccountStoreMappingList, ApplicationList, ChallengeList<T>, DirectoryList, FactorList<T>, FieldList, GroupList, GroupMembershipList, ModeledEmailTemplateList, OrganizationAccountStoreMappingList, OrganizationList, PasswordResetTokenList, PhoneList, RefreshTokenList, UnmodeledEmailTemplateList
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCollectionResource, DefaultAccessTokenList, DefaultAccountLinkList, DefaultAccountList, DefaultApiKeyList, DefaultApplicationAccountStoreMappingList, DefaultApplicationList, DefaultChallengeList, DefaultDirectoryList, DefaultFactorList, DefaultFieldList, DefaultGroupList, DefaultGroupMembershipList, DefaultModeledEmailTemplateList, DefaultOrganizationAccountStoreMappingList, DefaultOrganizationList, DefaultPhoneList, DefaultRefreshTokenList, DefaultUnmodeledEmailTemplateList

    public interface CollectionResource<T extends Resource>
extends Resource, Iterable<T>
    A CollectionResource is a first-class Resource that has its own properties (such as offset and limit, but also contains other Resource instances.
    Since:
    0.1

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.resource.Resource

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

    • Method Detail

      • getOffset

        int getOffset()
        Returns the index of the resource in the entire collection that is the first resource in the current page.

        All subsequent resources in the response page will immediately follow this index.

        For example, a paged query with an offset of 50 will return a page of results where the page contains the resource at index 50, then the resource at index 51, then at 52, 53, etc.

        If unspecified when retrieving the collection, this number defaults to 0, indicating that the results should start at the first result in the overall set (i.e the first 'page'). The maximum number of elements returned in a page is specified by the limit.

        Returns:
        the index of the resource in the entire collection that is the first resource in the current page.

      • getLimit

        int getLimit()
        Returns the maximum number of results included in a single page. If unspecified when retrieving the collection, this number defaults to 25. The minimum number allowed is 1, the maximum is 100.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of results included in a single page. Min: 1, Max: 100.

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Returns the total count (quantity) of all items across the entire collection. Pagination does not impact this value.

        The size property does not necessary express that all these items have been transferred from the backend. This value indicates the total quantity of items that the list contains but, in order to avoid retrieving a large amount of data at once from the backend, the list is actually paginated with the size specified by limit. This means, that for example, if a list has a size of 100 and the limit is 25, the backend will be contacted four times and 25 items will be retrieved each time.

        Returns:
        the total quantity of items that this CollectionResource contains.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4

      • single

        T single()
        This is just a convenience method to retrieve the single element expected to exist in this collection. This method is intended to be used in cases where the returned list is explicitly expected to contain a single element. This operation will throw an exception if this list contains zero or more than one element.

        This method is not backed by any specific property obtained from the backend, as already mentioned, this is a convenience method.

        Returns:
        the single unique resource that is expect to be contained within this list.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this list contains either zero or more than one element.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.4
